tournament.name: MTG China Open S8 Regional Championship - Dragon Shield Cup

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach along with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to create a powerful combo that allows for repetitive casting of spells from the graveyard. By milling cards with Grinding Station and using Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal for mana acceleration, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game through either milling the opponent out with Thassa's Oracle or dealing direct damage with Malevolent Rumble. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional utility and consistency to the deck.

This aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents' resources and board state while applying pressure with efficient creatures. Using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game, along with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Ketramose, the New Dawn, the deck aims to win quickly and decisively. By combining disruptive elements with aggressive threats, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory. Additionally, the inclusion of Ephemerate and other flicker effects provides additional value and flexibility in key moments.

The deck focuses on using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to continuously loop through cards in graveyard, creating a combo engine that can quickly mill the opponent's library or win through alternate win conditions like Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes various artifacts and spell cards that synergize with the combo pieces, providing control elements and protection. It aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and achieve victory.

The main strategy of this UW Control deck is to control the game through countering spells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan using cards like Counterspell, Prismatic Ending, and Narset, Parter of Veils, while also generating card advantage with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and LÃ³rien Revealed. The deck also has a touch of creature removal with cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies. The mana base is fine-tuned to provide the necessary colors for casting spells efficiently.

The deck revolves around using a variety of creatures to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By combining creatures with various abilities like sacrifice, recursion, and tutoring, the deck aims to create powerful synergies and combos to outpace and outmaneuver opponents. The deck utilizes cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to generate value and fuel its engine, with cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to find the right creature for any given situation. The deck also includes cards like Walking Ballista and Grist, the Hunger Tide for additional win conditions.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggression. By playing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the deck aims to control the battlefield and deal damage quickly. The Leyline cards and Leyline Binding provide additional support by boosting the deck's synergy and consistency. The inclusion of dual lands and fetch lands ensures the deck has the necessary mana base to consistently cast its spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful combo pieces to win without the need for traditional lands. By carefully managing resources and leveraging key cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Goblin Charbelcher, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominating board state and overwhelm opponents. With a mix of control elements and card draw, the deck can disrupt enemy strategies while setting up its own win conditions efficiently. The use of efficient creature removal and countermagic ensures that the deck can handle a variety of opposing threats and maintain consistency in executing its game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence of Merfolk creatures with the help of Lords of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost each other's power and toughness. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Tide Shaper and Tishana's Tidebinder while also using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play. The deck has some counter spells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation for added protection. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo by using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to cheat out powerful creatures like Chancellor of the Tangle and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. These creatures generate mana and allow for explosive plays to be made, culminating in casting large threats like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Koma, World-Eater. The deck also includes disruption in the form of cards like Force of Vigor and Solitude to protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow, Nethergoyf, and Mockingbird to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble, Fatal Push, and Stubborn Denial to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Thoughtseize and Dress Down help with hand disruption and managing threats on the battlefield. The deck runs a low land count with a mix of fetch lands and shock lands to efficiently play its spells and creatures.

This deck aims to control the game and ramp up mana to play powerful Eldrazi creatures. Cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Malevolent Rumble help control the board while Talisman of Impulse and Utopia Sprawl accelerate mana production. Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker are key threats that can quickly turn the tide of the game. Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and access to artifacts, adding another layer of control. The deck utilizes a mix of creature threats, removal spells, and ramp to disrupt the opponent's game plan and dominate the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's actions through a combination of disruption, removal, and card advantage. The deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, and graveyard hate like Relic of Progenitus. In addition, the deck utilizes creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn, Abhorrent Oculus, Subtlety, and Psychic Frog to provide additional control and threats on the board. The land base is optimized for fixing mana and fetching key lands when needed. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game.
